paragraphs.text:
%md
# About
**Lab:** Hive File Formats
**Objective:** Become familiar with using Hive with different file formats
**File locations:** hostname:/tmp/dc hdfs://data/dc/dc-wikia-data.csv
**Successful outcome:** Understanding hive file formats
**Before you begin:**
**Related lessons:** Hive File Formats

---

msg.data:
About

Lab: Hive File Formats
Objective: Become familiar with using Hive with different file formats
File locations: hostname:/tmp/dc hdfs://data/dc/dc-wikia-data.csv
Successful outcome: Understanding hive file formats
Before you begin:
Related lessons: Hive File Formats

paragraphs.text:
%md
# Setup

paragraphs.title: Get the data from github
paragraphs.text:
%sh
rm /tmp/dc-wikia-data.csv
wget https://github.com/fivethirtyeight/data/raw/master/comic-characters/dc-wikia-data.csv -O /tmp/dc-wikia-data.csv

paragraphs.title: List the file
paragraphs.text:
%sh
ls /tmp/dc-wikia-data.csv

paragraphs.title: Store the data into HDFS
paragraphs.text:
%sh
sudo -u hdfs hdfs dfs -rm -r -skipTrash /data/dc
sudo -u hdfs hdfs dfs -mkdir /data/dc
sudo -u hdfs hdfs dfs -put /tmp/dc-wikia-data.csv /data/dc

paragraphs.title: Grant Hive and Zeppelin access to /data/dc
paragraphs.text:
%sh
sudo -u hdfs hdfs dfs -chmod -R 777 /data/dc

paragraphs.title: List the contents of HDFS /data/dc
paragraphs.text:
%sh
hdfs dfs -ls /data/dc

paragraphs.title: Use Spark to store the data in a parquet file
paragraphs.text:
%spark

val df = spark.read.format("csv").option("header", "true").load("/data/dc/dc-wikia-data.csv")
val df_new = df.select((col("page_id")),
                       (col("name")),
                       (col("urlslug")),
                       (col("ID")),
                       (col("ALIGN")),
                       (col("EYE")),
                       (col("HAIR")),
                       (col("SEX")),
                       (col("GSM")),
                       (col("APPEARANCES")),
                       (col("FIRST APPEARANCE").alias("FA")),
                       (col("YEAR")))
df_new.write.mode("overwrite").parquet("/data/dc/dc-wikia-data.parquet")

paragraphs.title: List the /data/dc/ to see the dc-wikia-data.parquet file
paragraphs.text:
%sh
hdfs dfs -ls /data/dc

paragraphs.title: Add Avro files to HDFS
paragraphs.text:
%sh
rm -r /tmp/avro
mkdir /tmp/avro
chmod 777 /tmp/avro
sudo -u devuser cp /home/devuser/bin/avro/* /tmp/avro

paragraphs.title: List the directory /tmp/avro
paragraphs.text:
%sh
ls /tmp/avro

paragraphs.title: Move the Avro data into HDFS
paragraphs.text:
%sh
sudo -u hdfs hdfs dfs -rm -r -skipTrash /data/avro
sudo -u hdfs hdfs dfs -mkdir /data/avro
sudo -u hdfs hdfs dfs -put /tmp/avro/* /data/avro

paragraphs.title: List the contents of HDFS /data/avro
paragraphs.text:
%sh
hdfs dfs -ls /data/avro

%md
# Lab
- For this Lab we will use Hive Interactive query.
- Prefix all queries with %jdbc(hive_interactive)

msg.data:
Lab

  • For this Lab we will use Hive Interactive query.
  • Prefix all queries with %jdbc(hive_interactive)

paragraphs.text:
%md
### Hive table with data stored in parquet formet

We are going to create a table where data is stored in parquet format.

~~~
CREATE TABLE dc_comics_parquet( 
                        page_id string,
                        name string,
                        urlslug string,
                        ID string,
                        ALIGN string,
                        EYE string,
                        HAIR string,
                        SEX string,
                        GSM string,
                        ALIVE string,
                        APPEARANCES string,
                        FIRST_APPEARANCES string,
                        YEAR string
                        ) 
STORED AS Parquet;

~~~

But first we need to drop the table if it already exists.

paragraphs.text:
%md

### Hive table with data stored using the ORC format

We are going to create an exterrnal staging table that will be used to load data in an orc table.

~~~
CREATE EXTERNAL TABLE dc_comics_stage ( 
                        page_id string,
                        name string,
                        urlslug string,
                        ID string,
                        ALIGN string,
                        EYE string,
                        HAIR string,
                        SEX string,
                        GSM string,
                        ALIVE string,
                        APPEARANCES string,
                        FIRST_APPEARANCES string,
                        YEAR string
                        ) 
ROW FORMAT DELIMITED 
FIELDS TERMINATED BY ',' 
LOCATION '/warehouse/tablespace/external/hive/dc_comics_stage/' ;
~~~

But first we need to drop the table if it already exists.

paragraphs.text:
%md
Next we are going to create the ORC data format table

~~~
CREATE TABLE dc_comics ( 
                        page_id string,
                        name string,
                        urlslug string,
                        ID string,
                        ALIGN string,
                        EYE string,
                        HAIR string,
                        SEX string,
                        GSM string,
                        ALIVE string,
                        APPEARANCES string,
                        FIRST_APPEARANCES string,
                        YEAR string
                        )  
STORED AS ORC 
~~~

But first we need to drop the table if it already exists.

paragraphs.text:
%md
### Hive table with data stored using avro schema
We are going to create a table with avro servde and avro schema.
The avro-tools utility can be used to generate the avro schema or sample.avsc

~~~
CREATE TABLE sample_table

ROW FORMAT
SERDE 'org.apache.hadoop.hive.serde2.avro.AvroSerDe'
WITH SERDEPROPERTIES (
    'avro.schema.url'='hdfs:///labs/data/sample.avsc')

STORED AS
INPUTFORMAT 'org.apache.hadoop.hive.ql.io.avro.AvroContainerInputFormat'
OUTPUTFORMAT 'org.apache.hadoop.hive.ql.io.avro.AvroContainerOutputFormat';

~~~

But first we need to drop the table if it already exists.

%md
# Result
**You have now:** You have now successfully created Hive tables that store data in multiple formats. As well as write several SQL statements to query the data.

---

STORED AS

paragraphs.title: 18 - Find all the character names that are good and are female. Put them in alphabetical order. Limit 10
paragraphs.text:
%jdbc(hive_interactive)
SELECT name FROM dc_comics WHERE ALIGN='Good Characters' AND SEX='Female Characters' LIMIT 10

table.tableOptionSpecHash: [{"name":"useFilter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable filter for columns"},{"name":"showPagination","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable pagination for better navigation"},{"name":"showAggregationFooter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable a footer for displaying aggregated values"}]

paragraphs.title: 19 - List the name  and gender of the characters that have secret identities. Order by gender. Don't include characters with no gender (Limit 10)
paragraphs.text:
%jdbc(hive_interactive)
SELECT name, sex FROM dc_comics WHERE ID = 'Secret Identity' AND (sex ='Female Characters' OR sex= 'Male Characters') ORDER BY sex

table.tableOptionSpecHash: [{"name":"useFilter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable filter for columns"},{"name":"showPagination","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable pagination for better navigation"},{"name":"showAggregationFooter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable a footer for displaying aggregated values"}]

paragraphs.title: 20 - Find the count of all the characters that have blue eyes and have blond hair
paragraphs.text:
%jdbc(hive_interactive)
SELECT count(*) AS cnt FROM dc_comics WHERE eye= 'Blue Eyes' AND hair ='Blond Hair'

table.tableOptionSpecHash: [{"name":"useFilter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable filter for columns"},{"name":"showPagination","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable pagination for better navigation"},{"name":"showAggregationFooter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable a footer for displaying aggregated values"}]

paragraphs.text:
%md
We hope you've enjoyed this lab. Below are additional resources that you should find useful:

1. [Cloudera Apache Spark Tutorials](http://hortonworks.com/tutorials/#tuts-developers) are your natural next step where you can explore Spark in more depth.
2. [Cloudera Community Connection (HCC)](https://community.hortonworks.com/spaces/85/data-science.html?type=question) is a great resource for questions and answers on Spark, Data Analytics/Science, and many more Big Data topics.
3. [Cloudera Apache Spark Docs](https://docs.hortonworks.com/HDPDocuments/HDP3/HDP-3.0.1/spark-overview/content/analyzing_data_with_apache_spark.html) - official Spark documentation.
4. [Cloudera Apache Zeppelin Docs](https://docs.hortonworks.com/HDPDocuments/HDP3/HDP-3.0.1/zeppelin-overview/content/overview.html) - official Zeppelin documentation.

msg.data:
We hope you've enjoyed this lab. Below are additional resources that you should find useful:

  1. Cloudera Apache Spark Tutorials are your natural next step where you can explore Spark in more depth.
  2. Cloudera Community Connection (HCC) is a great resource for questions and answers on Spark, Data Analytics/Science, and many more Big Data topics.
  3. Cloudera Apache Spark Docs - official Spark documentation.
  4. Cloudera Apache Zeppelin Docs - official Zeppelin documentation.
